definition: to deprive/to withhold/to hold sth back (and prevent it being known)
button

to fasten/to button/button/buckle/knot/to arrest/to confiscate/to deduct (money)/discount/to knock/to smash, spike or dunk (a ball)/to cover (with a bowl etc)/(fig.) to tag a label on sb/(Tw) (loanword) code

sentences.english: Their wages were reduced or held up for no reason.
sentences.chinese: 他们的工资被毫无道理地降低或扣发。

sentences.english: His employer garnished his wages in order to pay his debt.
sentences.chinese: 他的雇主扣发他的工资还债。

sentences.english: The board has decided to withhold part of their grant money from certain students.
sentences.chinese: 委员会决定扣发某些学生的部分助学金。

sentences.english: Ueported absence will give rise to salary deduction and disciplinary punishment.
sentences.chinese: 无故缺勤和擅自离岗将导致扣发工资和纪律处分。

sentences.english: The company withholds part of its employees' earning for income taxes.
sentences.chinese: 公司由于收入税的问题扣发了员工的部分收入。

sentences.english: A loose brass knob on the bedstead rattled.
sentences.chinese: 床架上一个松动的球形铜扣发出嘎啦声。

sentences.english: Unreported absence will give rise to salary deduction and disciplinary punishment.
sentences.chinese: 无故缺勤和擅自离岗将导致扣发工资和纪律处分。

sentences.english: Keep a portion of sb. 's pay back.
sentences.chinese: 扣发某人的一部分工资。

sentences.english: Their salaries were held out for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 他们的工资被扣发了很长时间。

sentences.english: You have no right to keep a portion of my pay back.
sentences.chinese: 你无权扣发我的一部分工资。
